greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: row n gives numerators of fractions in the Farey subsequence B(m).
comment: B(n) is denoted by F(B(2n),n) in Matveev (2017) - see definition on page 1. B(n) consists of the terms h/k of the Farey series F_{2n} such that k-n <= h <= n.
reference: A. O. Matveev, Farey Sequences, De Gruyter, 2017.
example: The first few sequences B(1), B(2), B(3), B(4) are:
maple: Farey := proc(n) sort(convert(`union`({0}, {seq(seq(m/k, m=1..k), k=1..n)}), list)) end:
B := proc(m) local a,i,h,k; global Farey; a:=[];
if (h <= m) and (k-m <= h) then a:=[op(a),i]; fi; od: a; end;
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 10 2019
